snippet: Officials have had to shuffle schedules and deploy crews to spread snow stockpiled from last year as the springlike sun sends temperatures into the upper 50s and higher in some areas.
abstract: Winter Olympics are melting under a heat wave, from coast of Sochi, where spectators have been spotted sunbathing, to mountains high above the city, where cross-country skiers race in sleeveless jerseys; balmy weather has forced changes in competition schedules, sent workers scrambling to harden the slushy snow and made Olympians reconsider what to wear for their warm-weather winter sports.

byline.original: By JOHN BRANCH and SAM DOLNICK
byline.contributor: Mary Pilon, Bill Pennington, Ken Belson and Nikolay Khalip contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Officials have had to shuffle schedules and deploy crews to spread snow stockpiled from last year as the springlike sun sends temperatures into the upper 50s and higher in some areas.

headline.main: Olympic Officials Scramble to Counter Warm Weather
